result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrianna C. Eckman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay fine of $ 200.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case to be determined within 60 days.  Expungement Review on 8/28/14 @ 11:30 a.m. upon successful completion of probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Everett King.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Defendant pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and there has been no request for restitution.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; defendant placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.  Expungement Review Hearing on 8/28/15 at 11:30 AM.
to Preliminary Hearing

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 8-7-14 @ 2:30pm with co-def. Bond continued.
